title: A Look into November 2024 Destruction in EVE Online – The Revenant Expansion Edition
description: We’re back once again to look at the destruction details for EVE Online.  The November Monthly Economic Report, the MER, ran a little late this time around.  We had been getting used to it showing up in the first few days of the month, but this time around it didn’t land until the 12th… and […]
author: Wilhelm Arcturus
excerpt: We’re back once again to look at the destruction details for EVE Online. The November Monthly Economic Report, the MER, ran a little late this time around. We had been getting used to it sh…
text: We’re back once again to look at the destruction details for EVE Online.  The November Monthly Economic Report, the MER, ran a little late this time around.  We had been getting used to it showing up in the first few days of the month, but this time around it didn’t land until the 12th… and was broken.  CCP has since published a corrected sinks and faucets chart to fix the problem. EVE Online nerds harder As always, I am going to cover destruction.  Here are the usual places to look if you want more details or different coverage of New Eden economic activity for the month. CCP – November 2024 Monthly Economic Report CCP – Corrected Sinks and Faucets HTML CCP – November 2024 MER Forum Thread Reddit – November 2024 MER Thread TNG – November 2024 Activity In EVE Online TNG – A Look At The November 2024 Active ISK Delta (coming) YouTube – November MER Analysis with CSM Oz Overall Summary November saw the Revenant expansion hit New Eden, so the question is always whether or not that boosted logins, because there is at least a correlation between people logged in and destruction. Going to Jester’s four year comparison chart, it does look like November kept the rise out of the post-Equinox summer slump going. Nov 2024 – Four Year Comparison There 2024 doesn’t look so bad, really.  While Equinox clearly didn’t offset summer vacations… likely because it wasn’t done yet… even the low points are higher than past summers.  And logins looked to be ramping up better than before the Havoc expansion of November 2023. Looking at 2024 by itself with the 7 day rolling average, which is a lot more volatile, you can see the effect of the 7 Days of free Omega time offer. (A little more complicated this time, as CCP gave you 10 PLEX, then let you have 7 days of Omega for 10 PLEX.)  I know I logged in my otherwise neglected fourth account to get in a few days of login rewards and training. Nov 2024 – EVE Players 2024 So it is established that more people were logged in during November.  Did that translate into more destruction. In a word: Yes. November saw reported 531,081  hulls, structures, and capsules destroyed, up from the 496,807 reported in October and the 456,571 reported in September.  More things exploded… and in fewer days as November is one of those 30 day months. November 2024 did not, however, reach the heights of November 2023, when CCP recorded 571,018 losses.  Revenant brought people into the game, but didn’t cause the destruction that Havoc did. That gives us an average losses per day number of 17,702 for November, which again is a noticeable uptick on the chart I have been keeping. Nov 2024 – Average Losses per Day You can see Revenant reaching for the Havoc high water mark and not quite making it.  Still, 2024 remains a solid year for destruction, the best since CCP imposed its starvation economy on the game, an act that single-handedly curtailed in-game activity on a scale since the ill-conceived Black Out of the “chaos era.” The ISK front did not see a similar rise, though it was up, with November ringing in 45.15 trillion ISK in losses, a small uptick from the 44.78 trillion ISK in losses seen in October.  That corresponds to 1.5 trillion ISK lost per day in November versus 1.44 trillion ISK per day in October.  The average loss in November was 85 million ISK in value while in October it was 90 million ISK in value. Basically more things blew up in November, but they were slightly cheaper things on average. The course of the month itself followed a somewhat predictable pattern as the losses per day chart shows. Nov 2024 – Losses per Day Weekend peaks are the usual pattern.  Even the Revenant launch day didn’t change the pattern all that much.  It wasn’t the lowest day for destruction, but it certainly didn’t stand out either. The outlier on the chart is the 29th.  But we’ll get to what happened on the 29th in a bit. Top 20 Most Frequent Losses by Class and Hull The usual simple count of the ships and such most destroyed in New Eden over the course of the month. Class  Count  % of Nov Hull  Count  % of Nov Capsule        127,234 23.96% Capsule        125,687 23.67% Shuttle           73,612 13.86% Caldari Shuttle           30,948 5.83% Frigate           60,879 11.46% Ibis           21,753 4.10% Cruiser           45,682 8.60% Amarr Shuttle           14,989 2.82% Corvette           36,468 6.87% Gallente Shuttle           14,966 2.82% Destroyer           35,553 6.69% Mobile Tractor Unit           12,379 2.33% Combat Battlecruiser           17,723 3.34% Minmatar Shuttle           12,013 2.26% Mobile Tractor Unit           12,958 2.44% Venture           11,591 2.18% Hauler             9,991 1.88% Vexor             8,546 1.61% Interdictor             9,773 1.84% Reaper             7,286 1.37% Heavy Assault Cruiser             9,461 1.78% Algos             6,880 1.30% Interceptor             8,834 1.66% Ishtar             6,176 1.16% Assault Frigate             8,401 1.58% Heron             5,958 1.12% Battleship             8,080 1.52% Catalyst             5,579 1.05% Mobile Warp Disruptor             5,111 0.96% Exequror Navy Issue             5,540 1.04% Strategic Cruiser             4,686 0.88% Thrasher             4,767 0.90% Mining Barge             4,448 0.84% Sabre             4,300 0.81% Tactical Destroyer             4,411 0.83% Velator             4,084 0.77% Stealth Bomber             4,346 0.82% Caracal             3,411 0.64% Covert Ops             4,087 0.77% Mobile Small Warp Disruptor I             3,379 0.64% Hulls Lost only Once This Month Some actual meat on the bone for the single kills this month. Hull Count AIR Civilian Astero 1 Avatar 1 Azariel 1 Boobook 1 Civilian Caldari Shuttle 1 Cobra 1 Erebus 1 ‘Excavator’ Mining Drone 1 Geri 1 InterBus Shuttle 1 Komodo 1 Miasmos Amastris Edition 1 Primae 1 Revenant 1 Sidewinder 1 Utu 1 Valravn 1 Vanquisher 1 There are some tasty items on the list, including the Vanquisher, the Azariel, and the Komodo, all faction titans, and three of the five titans lost in a capital clash in 1N-FJ8 at the end of the month when Fraternity’s supercap defense fleet was baited into a dread bomb. (Video here.) The is the first Azariel lost in combat.  Brave previously built one and then blew it up to get the first such kill. Also, there was a Revenant lost… to celebrate the Revenant expansion I hope! Then there are some Alliance Tournament ships like the Utu, the Geri, the Cobra, and the Sidewinder, the last two being from the recently concluded ATXX. Top 20 Total ISK Lost by Hull Type Then there is the ISK side of the loss equation. Hull  Count  Sum of ISK Lost % of Nov ISK per Loss Capsule        125,687 3,594.57 billion 7.96% 28.60 million Vargur                868 1,913.06 billion 4.24% 2,203.99 million Ishtar             6,176 1,444.80 billion 3.20% 233.94 million Loki             1,811 1,416.02 billion 3.14% 781.90 million Paladin                530 1,101.90 billion 2.44% 2,079.06 million Golem                568 1,067.35 billion 2.36% 1,879.14 million Tengu             1,413 1,059.80 billion 2.35% 750.03 million Gila             2,531 969.53 billion 2.15% 383.06 million Revelation                175 881.42 billion 1.95% 5,036.70 million Kronos                399 739.95 billion 1.64% 1,854.51 million Praxis             2,454 723.44 billion 1.60% 294.80 million Proteus                886 669.46 billion 1.48% 755.60 million Exequror Navy Issue             5,540 506.59 billion 1.12% 91.44 million Athanor                331 504.80 billion 1.12% 1,525.08 million Fortizar                  37 489.58 billion 1.08% 1,3231.84 million Barghest                260 487.32 billion 1.08% 1,874.31 million Nestor                242 483.46 billion 1.07% 1,997.78 million Redeemer                294 461.22 billion 1.02% 1,568.78 million Occator                533 449.67 billion 1.00% 843.67 million Machariel                245 426.50 billion 0.94% 1,740.83 million You can take as read the usual quantity comment about capsules.  And marauders continue to haunt this list, while Ishtars, the favored AFK to semi-AFK ratting ride, make the cut through quantity as well. But you can see some effects of the month, and that battle in 1N-FJ8, with Revelations and Redeemers making the cut, along with Machariels.  The Mach used to be a common doctrine until CCP made battleships expensive, and faction battleships doubly so. Top 20 Regions by ISK and Hull Losses Now into where the month’s losses happened, starting at a regional level. Region Sum of ISK Lost % of Nov Region  Count  % of Nov Vale of the Silent 3.05 trillion 6.76% The Forge        61,267 11.54% Pochven 2.71 trillion 6.01% Lonetrek        24,023 4.52% The Forge 1.87 trillion 4.13% Black Rise        23,737 4.47% Black Rise 1.34 trillion 2.96% The Citadel        21,003 3.95% The Citadel 1.33 trillion 2.94% Pochven        20,220 3.81% Delve 1.28 trillion 2.84% Heimatar        19,959 3.76% Fountain 1.23 trillion 2.73% Metropolis        17,887 3.37% Metropolis 1.07 trillion 2.37% The Bleak Lands        16,715 3.15% Catch 1.03 trillion 2.28% Vale of the Silent        16,658 3.14% Sinq Laison 1.02 trillion 2.27% Delve        15,878 2.99% Perrigen Falls 1.02 trillion 2.27% Placid        12,610 2.37% Lonetrek 1.02 trillion 2.25% Fountain        12,122 2.28% Tenerifis .94 trillion 2.09% Catch        12,065 2.27% Feythabolis .82 trillion 1.81% Perrigen Falls        11,680 2.20% Genesis .81 trillion 1.79% Essence        11,527 2.17% Placid .75 trillion 1.66% Tenerifis        10,704 2.02% Heimatar .71 trillion 1.58% Sinq Laison        10,270 1.93% The Bleak Lands .70 trillion 1.56% Genesis           8,108 1.53% Querious .69 trillion 1.54% Providence           8,021 1.51% Providence .67 trillion 1.49% Querious           7,794 1.47% Once again, that battle in 1N-FJ8 shines through.  Blowing up a bunch of capital ships, including faction titans, will tend to boost your ISK numbers.  Vale of the Silent is an active region in general, being Fraternity’s front yard, but that really boosted the ISK number. On the count side of things… well, there is The Forge again… and we know why.  That is obvious with the next chart. Top 20 Systems by ISK and Hull Losses Down to the system level and we can see the hot spots. System Region Sum of ISK Lost % of Nov System Region  Count  % of Nov 1N-FJ8 Vale of the Silent 1,349.22 billion 2.99% Uitra The Forge        43,585 8.21% Jita The Forge 635.49 billion 1.41% Jita The Forge           8,853 1.67% Ahbazon Genesis 477.72 billion 1.06% Jouvulen Lonetrek           7,469 1.41% Kinakka Black Rise 421.54 billion 0.93% Malukker Heimatar           6,873 1.29% 9-02G0 Detorid 323.17 billion 0.72% Akiainavas Lonetrek           6,172 1.16% Sakenta Pochven 266.98 billion 0.59% Ahbazon Genesis           6,078 1.14% Tama The Citadel 259.91 billion 0.58% Kusomonmon The Citadel           5,607 1.06% UALX-3 Tenerifis 248.95 billion 0.55% Tama The Citadel           4,937 0.93% 4-HWWF Vale of the Silent 242.88 billion 0.54% Kamela The Bleak Lands           4,479 0.84% Heydieles Essence 241.82 billion 0.54% Amamake Heimatar           3,888 0.73% MJ-5F9 Perrigen Falls 240.48 billion 0.53% Kinakka Black Rise           3,713 0.70% PO-3QW Feythabolis 239.33 billion 0.53% MJ-5F9 Perrigen Falls           3,482 0.66% Amamake Heimatar 237.20 billion 0.53% UALX-3 Tenerifis           3,270 0.62% Uedama The Citadel 216.08 billion 0.48% Vlillirier Placid           3,085 0.58% Ichoriya Pochven 214.27 billion 0.47% Kourmonen The Bleak Lands           2,862 0.54% G-B3PR Omist 202.83 billion 0.45% Heydieles Essence           2,709 0.51% Sivala The Citadel 192.78 billion 0.43% Pynekastoh Black Rise           2,518 0.47% Kamela The Bleak Lands 191.72 billion 0.42% PO-3QW Feythabolis           2,440 0.46% Josameto The Forge 181.29 billion 0.40% 4-HWWF Vale of the Silent           2,354 0.44% BWF-ZZ Geminate 177.89 billion 0.39% Zarzakh Yasna Zakh           2,347 0.44% On the ISK side, you can see the cost of the battle at 1N-FJ8.  There were some other kills during the month, but the bulk that contributed to that 1.3 trillion ISK in losses was that fight. On the count side, there is Uitra again.  Always Uitra.  But I had a couple of people reach out to me about what is going on there that made me realize I was thinking about it in… if not the wrong way, in a way that did not account for the varied motivations of New Eden capsuleers.  I was locked in a specific mindset and now I think I see a bit more clearly. So Uitra will be a follow on post.  I won’t belabor it here.  Instead I will look at another system for this month’s bonus chart.  Can you guess which one? A List of Kills for 1N-FJ8 This is just a listing of the kills recorded for this month’s most costly system for the entire month.  This shows what went into hitting that 1.3 trillion ISK number.  This is sorted by ISK contribution to that total. Hull Count Sum of ISK Lost ISK per Loss Revelation 116 592.04 billion 5,103.80 million Naglfar 39 152.01 billion 3,897.64 million Moros 18 103.45 billion 5,747.08 million Komodo 1 90.96 billion million Crucifier 2 15.12 million 7.56 million Dromi I 1 8.84 million 8.84 million Atron 2 8.75 million 4.37 million Dragoon 1 8.03 million 8.03 million Nereus 1 6.94 million 6.94 million Slasher 2 5.94 million 2.97 million Cormorant 1 5.56 million 5.56 million Dragonfly I 1 5.35 million 5.35 million Einherji I 1 5.02 million 5.02 million Iteron Mark V 1 4.48 million 4.48 million Badger 2 1.64 million .82 million Vigil 1 1.06 million 1.06 million Reaper 2 .96 million .48 million Council Diplomatic Shuttle 1 .64 million .64 million Minmatar Shuttle 3 .42 million .14 million Velator 3 .26 million .09 million Amarr Shuttle 7 .19 million .03 million Ibis 2 .17 million .09 million Caldari Shuttle 4 .10 million .02 million Impairor 1 .09 million .09 million Gallente Shuttle 4 .05 million .01 million Mobile Cynosural Beacon 2 .00 million .00 million Mobile Sanguine Harvester 1 .00 million .00 million The most interesting thing about this chart is how comically wrong the values are for the three faction titans.  I mean, the titans overall are shown under current market value, but the idea that an Erebus and a Komodo are about the same price is topped by the idea that a Vanquisher could be had for 25 billion ISK and that an Azariel is somehow just a 14 billion ISK project. That is why you see even CCP feels the need to add in the zKillboard value estimates in its New Eden battles graphic, where that number is over 3 trillion ISK. Nov 2024 – The battle ID from CCP Once again, I will argue that CCP’s numbers have value in that they are at least generated consistently using the same process.  So the ISK losses as indicated by the killdump.csv are wrong, they are wrong in a consistent way so that on can see trends and changes. Anyway, that is it for the November count.  Next month we’ll get to see both December and 2024 as a whole.  Meanwhile, I need to go work on that Uitra post.
html:
We’re back once again to look at the destruction details for EVE Online.  The November Monthly Economic Report, the MER, ran a little late this time around.  We had been getting used to it showing up in the first few days of the month, but this time around it didn’t land until the 12th… and was broken.  CCP has since published a corrected sinks and faucets chart to fix the problem.

EVE Online nerds harder

As always, I am going to cover destruction.  Here are the usual places to look if you want more details or different coverage of New Eden economic activity for the month.

  • CCP – November 2024 Monthly Economic Report
  • CCP – Corrected Sinks and Faucets HTML
  • CCP – November 2024 MER Forum Thread
  • Reddit – November 2024 MER Thread
  • TNG – November 2024 Activity In EVE Online
  • TNG – A Look At The November 2024 Active ISK Delta (coming)
  • YouTube – November MER Analysis with CSM Oz

Overall Summary

November saw the Revenant expansion hit New Eden, so the question is always whether or not that boosted logins, because there is at least a correlation between people logged in and destruction.

Going to Jester’s four year comparison chart, it does look like November kept the rise out of the post-Equinox summer slump going.

Nov 2024 – Four Year Comparison

There 2024 doesn’t look so bad, really.  While Equinox clearly didn’t offset summer vacations… likely because it wasn’t done yet… even the low points are higher than past summers.  And logins looked to be ramping up better than before the Havoc expansion of November 2023.

Looking at 2024 by itself with the 7 day rolling average, which is a lot more volatile, you can see the effect of the 7 Days of free Omega time offer. (A little more complicated this time, as CCP gave you 10 PLEX, then let you have 7 days of Omega for 10 PLEX.)  I know I logged in my otherwise neglected fourth account to get in a few days of login rewards and training.

Nov 2024 – EVE Players 2024

So it is established that more people were logged in during November.  Did that translate into more destruction.

In a word: Yes.

November saw reported 531,081  hulls, structures, and capsules destroyed, up from the 496,807 reported in October and the 456,571 reported in September.  More things exploded… and in fewer days as November is one of those 30 day months.

November 2024 did not, however, reach the heights of November 2023, when CCP recorded 571,018 losses.  Revenant brought people into the game, but didn’t cause the destruction that Havoc did.

That gives us an average losses per day number of 17,702 for November, which again is a noticeable uptick on the chart I have been keeping.

Nov 2024 – Average Losses per Day

You can see Revenant reaching for the Havoc high water mark and not quite making it.  Still, 2024 remains a solid year for destruction, the best since CCP imposed its starvation economy on the game, an act that single-handedly curtailed in-game activity on a scale since the ill-conceived Black Out of the “chaos era.”

The ISK front did not see a similar rise, though it was up, with November ringing in 45.15 trillion ISK in losses, a small uptick from the 44.78 trillion ISK in losses seen in October.  That corresponds to 1.5 trillion ISK lost per day in November versus 1.44 trillion ISK per day in October.  The average loss in November was 85 million ISK in value while in October it was 90 million ISK in value.

Basically more things blew up in November, but they were slightly cheaper things on average.

The course of the month itself followed a somewhat predictable pattern as the losses per day chart shows.

Nov 2024 – Losses per Day

Weekend peaks are the usual pattern.  Even the Revenant launch day didn’t change the pattern all that much.  It wasn’t the lowest day for destruction, but it certainly didn’t stand out either.

The outlier on the chart is the 29th.  But we’ll get to what happened on the 29th in a bit.

Top 20 Most Frequent Losses by Class and Hull

The usual simple count of the ships and such most destroyed in New Eden over the course of the month.

Class  Count  % of Nov Hull  Count  % of Nov
Capsule        127,234 23.96% Capsule        125,687 23.67%
Shuttle           73,612 13.86% Caldari Shuttle           30,948 5.83%

Hulls Lost only Once This Month

Some actual meat on the bone for the single kills this month.

Hull Count
AIR Civilian Astero 1
Avatar 1

There are some tasty items on the list, including the Vanquisher, the Azariel, and the Komodo, all faction titans, and three of the five titans lost in a capital clash in 1N-FJ8 at the end of the month when Fraternity’s supercap defense fleet was baited into a dread bomb. (Video here.)

The is the first Azariel lost in combat.  Brave previously built one and then blew it up to get the first such kill.

Also, there was a Revenant lost… to celebrate the Revenant expansion I hope!

Then there are some Alliance Tournament ships like the Utu, the Geri, the Cobra, and the Sidewinder, the last two being from the recently concluded ATXX.

Top 20 Total ISK Lost by Hull Type

Then there is the ISK side of the loss equation.

Hull  Count  Sum of ISK Lost % of Nov ISK per Loss
Capsule        125,687 3,594.57 billion 7.96% 28.60 million

You can take as read the usual quantity comment about capsules.  And marauders continue to haunt this list, while Ishtars, the favored AFK to semi-AFK ratting ride, make the cut through quantity as well.

But you can see some effects of the month, and that battle in 1N-FJ8, with Revelations and Redeemers making the cut, along with Machariels.  The Mach used to be a common doctrine until CCP made battleships expensive, and faction battleships doubly so.

Top 20 Regions by ISK and Hull Losses

Once again, that battle in 1N-FJ8 shines through.  Blowing up a bunch of capital ships, including faction titans, will tend to boost your ISK numbers.  Vale of the Silent is an active region in general, being Fraternity’s front yard, but that really boosted the ISK number.

On the count side of things… well, there is The Forge again… and we know why.  That is obvious with the next chart.

On the ISK side, you can see the cost of the battle at 1N-FJ8.  There were some other kills during the month, but the bulk that contributed to that 1.3 trillion ISK in losses was that fight.

On the count side, there is Uitra again.  Always Uitra.  But I had a couple of people reach out to me about what is going on there that made me realize I was thinking about it in… if not the wrong way, in a way that did not account for the varied motivations of New Eden capsuleers.  I was locked in a specific mindset and now I think I see a bit more clearly.

So Uitra will be a follow on post.  I won’t belabor it here.  Instead I will look at another system for this month’s bonus chart.  Can you guess which one?

The most interesting thing about this chart is how comically wrong the values are for the three faction titans.  I mean, the titans overall are shown under current market value, but the idea that an Erebus and a Komodo are about the same price is topped by the idea that a Vanquisher could be had for 25 billion ISK and that an Azariel is somehow just a 14 billion ISK project.

That is why you see even CCP feels the need to add in the zKillboard value estimates in its New Eden battles graphic, where that number is over 3 trillion ISK.

Nov 2024 – The battle ID from CCP

Once again, I will argue that CCP’s numbers have value in that they are at least generated consistently using the same process.  So the ISK losses as indicated by the killdump.csv are wrong, they are wrong in a consistent way so that on can see trends and changes.

Anyway, that is it for the November count.  Next month we’ll get to see both December and 2024 as a whole.  Meanwhile, I need to go work on that Uitra post.
